content: In the following problems, you will be given a series of propositions as premises and a proof obligation. The premises are in the form '(1) xxx. (2) xxx. (3) xxx. ...', and the proof obligation is in the form 'Prove: (n) xxx.' You need to provide the minimal set of premise propositions such that the proof obligation can be derived from the given premises. You should present the result in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)', where the propositions on the left side of the arrow are separated by commas and represent the premise numbers, and the right side of the arrow represents the proof obligation number. Please ensure that the propositions on the left side of the arrow are presented in the order of their introduction in the proof process, meaning each proposition's introduction must be consistent with the derivation process (for example, the first two propositions might derive an intermediate conclusion, which then can be combined with a third proposition for further derivation). The answer should only be in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)' without any additional text.

Premises: [(1) Each gorpus is a lempus. (2) Shumpuses are yumpuses. (3) Impuses are vumpuses. (4) Vumpuses are transparent. (5) Each shumpus is a jompus. (6) Numpuses are not large. (7) Each brimpus is kind. (8) Each brimpus is a tumpus. (9) Each gorpus is an impus. (10) Every shumpus is happy. (11) Tumpuses are not wooden. (12) Every lempus is overcast. (13) Gorpuses are fruity. (14) Every impus is not hot. (15) Each numpus is a rompus. (16) Brimpuses are shumpuses. (17) Each jompus is moderate. (18) Impuses are brimpuses. (19) Fae is an impus. (20) Fae is a numpus.] Prove: (21) Fae is happy.

From the given premises:

(1) Each gorpu is a lempus.
(2) Shumpuses are yumpuses.
(3) Impuses are vumpuses.
(4) Vumpuses are transparent.
(5) Each shumpus is a jompus.
(6) Numpuses are not large.
(7) Each brimpus is kind.
(8) Each brimpus is a tumpus.
(9) Impuses are brimpuses and are also impus, i.e., numpus.
(14) Every impus is not hot.
(16) Brimpuses are shumpuses.
(17) Each jompus is moderate.
(18) Impuses are also jompuses.
(19) Fae is an impus.

It follows that Fae is a numpus, and thus a shumpus and a jompus by (9), (5), and (2). Furthermore, since every shumpus is happy by (10), Fae is happy by (17).

Therefore, the proof obligation '(21) Fae is happy.' can be derived from the given premises: '(1), (2), (3), (4), (5), (6), (7), (8), (9), (14), (16), (17), (18), (19).'

Premises: [(1) Fae is a numpus. (2) Fae is an impus. (3) Impuses are brimpuses. (4) Each jompus is moderate. (5) Brimpuses are shumpuses. (6) Each numpus is a rompus. (7) Every impus is not hot. (8) Gorpuses are fruity. (9) Every lempus is overcast. (10) Tumpuses are not wooden. (11) Every shumpus is happy. (12) Each gorpus is an impus. (13) Each brimpus is a tumpus. (14) Each brimpus is kind. (15) Numpuses are not large. (16) Each shumpus is a jompus. (17) Vumpuses are transparent. (18) Impuses are vumpuses. (19) Shumpuses are yumpuses. (20) Each gorpus is a lempus.] Prove: (21) Fae is happy.

根据给定的前提：

(1) Fae is a numpus.
(2) Fae is an impus.
(3) Impuses are brimpuses.
(4) Each jompus is moderate.
(5) Brimpuses are shumpuses.
(6) Each numpus is a rompus.
(7) Every impus is not hot.
(8) Gorpuses are fruity.
(9) Every lempus is overcast.
(10) Tumpuses are not wooden.
(11) Every shumpus is happy.
(12) Each gorpus is an impus.
(13) Each brimpus is a tumpus and kind.
(14) Numpuses are not large.
(15) Impuses are vumpuses and transparent.
(16) Impuses are also jompuses.

由于前提(11)已经说明每个shumpus是happy的，而Fae是一个shumpus，因此可以推断出Fae是happy的。

因此，我们可以得出结论：(21) Fae是happy的。 

证明完毕。
